backgrounds.name: Acolyte
equipment: A prayer book or prayer wheel
backgrounds.feature_description: As an acolyte, you command the respect of those who share your faith, and you can perform the religious ceremonies of your deity. You and your companions can expect free healing and care at a temple of your faith.

backgrounds.name: Charlatan
equipment: Tools of the con of your choice
backgrounds.feature_description: You have created a second identity that includes documentation, established acquaintances, and disguises that allow you to assume that persona.

backgrounds.name: Criminal
equipment: Dark common clothes including a hood
backgrounds.feature_description: You have a reliable and trustworthy contact who acts as your liaison to a network of other criminals. You know how to get messages to and from your contact.

backgrounds.name: Entertainer
backgrounds.feature_description: You can always find a place to perform, and you receive free lodging and food of a modest or comfortable standard as long as you perform each night.

backgrounds.name: Folk Hero
backgrounds.feature_description: Since you come from the ranks of the common folk, you fit in among them with ease. You can find a place to hide, rest, or recuperate among other commoners, unless you have shown yourself to be a danger to them.

backgrounds.name: Guild Artisan
equipment: A letter of introduction from your guild
backgrounds.feature_description: Your guild offers lodging and food if necessary, and pays for your funeral if needed. You have access to guild halls and the political power of the guild.

backgrounds.name: Hermit
equipment: A scroll case full of notes from your studies
backgrounds.feature_description: The quiet seclusion of your extended hermitage gave you access to a unique and powerful discovery. It might be a great truth about the cosmos, the deities, or the forces of nature.

backgrounds.name: Noble
backgrounds.feature_description: Thanks to your noble birth, people are inclined to think the best of you. You are welcome in high society, and people assume you have the right to be wherever you are.

backgrounds.name: Outlander
equipment: A trophy from an animal you killed
backgrounds.feature_description: You have an excellent memory for maps and geography, and you can always recall the general layout of terrain, settlements, and other features around you. You can find food and fresh water for yourself and up to five other people each day.

backgrounds.name: Sage
equipment: A letter from a dead colleague posing a question you have not yet been able to answer
backgrounds.feature_description: When you attempt to learn or recall a piece of lore, if you do not know that information, you often know where and from whom you can obtain it.

backgrounds.name: Sailor
backgrounds.feature_description: When you need to, you can secure free passage on a sailing ship for yourself and your adventuring companions. The ship might be one you served on previously, or one whose captain owes you a favor.

backgrounds.name: Soldier
equipment: A trophy taken from a fallen enemy
A set of bone dice or deck of cards
backgrounds.feature_description: You have a military rank from your career as a soldier. Soldiers loyal to your former military organization still recognize your authority and influence, and they defer to you if they are of a lower rank.

backgrounds.name: Urchin
equipment: A map of the city you grew up in
A token to remember your parents by
backgrounds.feature_description: You know the secret patterns and flow to cities and can find passages through the urban sprawl that others would miss. When you are not in combat, you and companions you lead can travel between any two locations in the city twice as fast as your speed would normally allow.
